alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Goochland; New Kent; Powhatan; Western Chesterfield; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 2:56PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL CHESTERFIELD... NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN...SOUTHEASTERN GOOCHLAND...NORTHWESTERN NEW KENT...SOUTHERN CAROLINE...HENRICO...HANOVER...KING WILLIAM... EAST CENTRAL POWHATAN AND SOUTHEASTERN ESSEX COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sabot to Roxbury. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Richmond, Virginia Union University, Mechanicsville, Highland Springs, Tuckahoe, Virginia Commonwealth University, Laurel, Lakeside, East Highland Park, and Manakin around 300 PM EDT. Wyndham and Tunstall around 305 PM EDT. Studley around 310 PM EDT. King William, Ashland, Randolph Macon College, and Manquin around 315 PM EDT. Hanover around 320 PM EDT. Stevensville, Kings Dominion, Mangohick, and Aylett around 325 PM EDT. Saint Stephens Church and Dawn around 330 PM EDT. Millers Tavern and Beulahville around 335 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Gum Tree, Etna Mills, Montrose, Sandston, Glendale, Biscoe, Chamberlayne, Atlee, Ashcake, and Crouch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
